required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cesarean Scar Defects After Uterine Closure by Double-layer Barbed or Smooth Suture
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Pilot Study Comparing Incidence and Characteristics of Cesarean Scar Defects After Uterine Closure by Double-layer Barbed or Smooth Suture

brief_summary.textblock: Late sequelae of a cesarean section related to a uterine scar defects include gynecological symptoms and obstetric complications. The aim of this study was to evaluate the incidence and characteristics of cesarean scar defects after uterine closure by double-layer barbed suture.

primary_outcome.description: Number of complex uterine scar defects is evaluated by transvaginal ultrasound
Number of complex uterine scar defects is evaluated by transvaginal ultrasound
Number of complex uterine scar defects is evaluated by transvaginal ultrasound

secondary_outcome.measure: Residual myometrium thickness (RMT) in case of uterine scar defects
secondary_outcome.description: Residual myometrium thickness is evaluated by transvaginal ultrasound

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low transverse hysterotomy closed by double-layer unidirectional barbed suture
arm_group.description: Patients who had undergone cesarean section during which the low transverse hysterotomy was closed by double-layer unidirectional barbed suture

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low transverse hysterotomy closed by conventional double-layer smooth suture
arm_group.description: Patients who had undergone cesarean section during which the low transverse hysterotomy was closed by conventional double-layer smooth suture

intervention.description: Routinely post surgical assessment by objective examination and transvaginal ultrasonographic scan
intervention.arm_group_label: Low transverse hysterotomy closed by conventional double-layer smooth suture
Low transverse hysterotomy closed by double-layer unidirectional barbed suture

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent elective cesarean section at ≥ 38 weeks of gestation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had undergone elective cesarean section at ≥ 38 weeks of gestation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had undergone elective cesarean for the second time or after uterine surgery
- Patients who had undergone urgent elective cesarean

reference.citation: Agarwal S, D'Souza R, Ryu M, Maxwell C. Barbed vs conventional suture at cesarean delivery: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Acta Obstet Gynecol Scand. 2021 Jun;100(6):1010-1018. doi: 10.1111/aogs.14080. Epub 2021 Feb 5.
